comment: I enjoyed his class. Powerpoints, quizzes, and study guides were all useful for his exams. Lectures were almost never boring because he tries to encourage the class to participate in discussions.

He is not a easy professor to take but the way his grading is up, the test scores do not harm your grades bad unless your getting a 50 or less than a every test. So a C is achieve-able. Only has one opportunity for 4 extra credit points. Only take him if its your 2nd option not first in my opinion.

Hester is great! In order to get an A, you have to show up to class and fill out the PowerPoints. If you pay attention to the slides with stars, you will ace his tests! The quizzes are open note. He is super sweet and is always willing to go over your missed questions on tests and quizzes.

Dr hester really knows his stuff. After the craziness of ex phys 1, I was very nervous to take the second part. He made this class approachable and I ended up doing better than I ever thought. 3 tests with short answer/MC , open note quizzes, a group project, and a final. He is a very approachable person and a good choice for ex phys 2

Easy and amazing professor. Tests are MC and short-response. He is lenient with grading and allows partial credit. Quizzes are online and open-book to help practice. Everything is based off of powerpoints. Take him if you can!

TAKE HESTER!! He's such a great professor. Powerpoints guide the lectures and tests are completely based off of the powerpoints. There is an end-of-the-semester group project. He is a very lenient grader, even on the short-response questions on his exams. There are open-book online quizzes, super easy. Study the powerpoints always! EASY.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Hester is super approachable! He does grade his short answer questions a little tough but the material is manageable. The class is boring but he is a really great professor overall!

His lectures are horribly boring but you get extra credit for going. The tests aren't too hard but you really have to study the powerpoints well, he asks very specific questions from them. The class seems intimidating but he sets you up to do well.

I really liked Dr. Hester. He's old school with the lectures but its Ex Phys, how else will you learn it? He gives you easy extra credit opportunity and the grading scale makes it impossible to fail. I genuinely think I learned 100% more than with Ingram for Ex physiology 1.

Powerpoints are to the point. Online quizzes. If you study the powerpoints and the past quizzes you will get good grades on the tests. Does test reviews/study guides. Harsh grader when it come to short answer. Partner presentation. Extra credit for attendance.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This was professor first semester teaching and let's just say we were the guinea pigs. His grading for tests are tough you either get it or you don't. No partial credit! His lectures were boring and when asked a question he sometimes didn't know the answer! He required way too much. He was an okay teacher but I wouldn't recommend him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT
